author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: سُبْحانَكَ يا إِلهِي أَسْئَلُكَ بِالَّذِينَ طافُوا حَوْلَ عَرْشِ مَشِيَّتِكَ وَطارُوا فِيْ هَوآءِ إِرادَتِكَ وَأَقْبَلُوا بِقُلُوبِهِمْ إِلى أُفُقِ وَحْيِكَ وَمَشْرِقِ إِلْهامِكَ وَمَطْلَعِ أَسْمائِكَ بِأَنْ تُوَفِّقَ عِبادَكَ عَلَ
translation: Praised be Thou, O my God! I beseech Thee by them who have circled round the throne of Thy will, and soared in the atmosphere of Thy good pleasure, and turned with all their affections towards the Horizon of Thy Revelation and the Dayspring of Thine inspiration, and the Dawning-Place of Thy names, to aid Thy servants to observe what Thou hast commanded them in Thy days—commandments through which the sacredness of Thy Cause will be demonstrated unto Thy servants and the affairs of Thy creatures and of Thy realm will be set aright.
